definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
to keep up appearances/to put up a front
lit. to decorate the front of one's store (idiom)/fig. to embellish (one's CV, etc)/to keep up appearances/to put up a front
see 裝點門面|装点门面[zhuang1 dian3 men2 mian4]
to keep up appearances/to put up a front

sentences.english: A few who run shops have turned their storefronts into missing person displays.
sentences.chinese: 有些开店的人干脆把门面改成了失踪人口展览。

sentences.english: A:The ceiling is about eight feet high and the door is ten feet wide.
sentences.chinese: 楼底约八英尺高，门面约十英尺阔。

sentences.english: That was merely lip service, you should not believe him.
sentences.chinese: 那只不过是他的门面话，你不要完全相信。

sentences.english: The eastern facade is composed of loggias covered in bamboo.
sentences.chinese: 东部的门面是由凉廊中涉及竹子。

sentences.english: With little or no income, he is finding it increasingly difficult to keep up apperances.
sentences.chinese: 因为几乎没有收入，他发现维持门面愈来愈困难。

sentences.english: He only has those books for show; he never reads them.
sentences.chinese: 他的那些书只是装门面的，他从来不看。

sentences.english: To cater to them, many of the old lodges have been revamped.
sentences.chinese: 为了迎合游客的需求，许多门面又被重新修葺了。

sentences.english: A foundation or just a facade?
They're using him for a front man, just for a while, then the Japanese will take over .
sentences.chinese: 他们利用他充门面，要不了多久，日本人准接过去。

sentences.english: The stores are "the front face for Apple now, " Johnson said.
sentences.chinese: 零售店面是“苹果公司现在的门面，”詹森说。

sentences.english: He bought the saloon car to keep up appearances.
sentences.chinese: 他买这辆高级轿车主要是为了撑门面。

sentences.english: This article described a way to provide a Facade interface for enterprise services.
sentences.chinese: 本文描述了一种为企业服务提供门面接口的方法。

sentences.english: Non-operating income is often used by companies to window-dress their net income.
sentences.chinese: 非营业性收入通常被用来装饰门面。

sentences.english: The pointy roofs are being phased out and replaced by simple olive green facades.
sentences.chinese: 尖屋顶将逐渐取消，代之以简单的橄榄绿门面。

sentences.english: I want to rent a house with street frontage , and open a restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 我想租一间门面房，开一个小餐馆。

sentences.english: The storefront at the Shu Jen bookstore looks unassuming enough, but the owner has a basketful of stories.
sentences.chinese: 树人书店的门面看来不怎样，主人却有一箩筐故事。

definition: the store front/the part of a house facing the street serving as a store
